alert.note: Alert for Georgetown; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 07 at 3:25PM EDT until April 07 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Georgetown County in northeastern South Carolina... Southeastern Williamsburg County in northeastern South Carolina... * Until 400 PM EDT. * At 325 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lambert, or 13 miles west of Georgetown, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Georgetown, DeBordieu Colony, Pawleys Island, Andrews, Lambert, Sampit, Plantersville, Graves, Oatland, Litchfield Beach and Georgetown Memorial Hospital. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
